better.translation[0].definitions[0].def: more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc
better.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Your stereo is better than mine.
There must be a better way to do this.
We now have a much better understanding of the disease.
It was even better than last year.
better.translation[0].definitions[1].def: more healthy or less ill or painful than before
better.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She is a little better today, the doctor says.
I’m feeling much better, thank you.
better.translation[0].definitions[2].def: completely well again after an illness
better.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: When you’re better we can see about planning a trip.
I hope he gets better (=recovers from an illness) soon.
better.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: better
the comparative of good
She wants a better job.
The sales figures were far better than expected.
Lucy’s better at French than I am.
superior
better, especially in quality
German cars are far superior.
a superior product
He thinks men are superior to women.
preferable
more suitable or useful – used when saying which one you prefer
Cash would be preferable.
Anything would be preferable to the system we have now.
be an improvement on something
to be better than something that existed before
The engine is a huge improvement on previous diesel engines.
have the edge
to be slightly better than another person or thing – used especially when saying which one will win in a game or competition
Federer is likely to have the edge in Sunday’s game.
For me, this film has the edge over the others.
be miles ahead (of somebody/something)
to be very much better than someone or something that you are competing against
The company is streets ahead of its rivals.
there’s no comparison
used to emphasize that one person or thing is clearly much better than someone or something else
There’s no comparison between the two teams.
‘Which apartment do you prefer?’ ‘Well, there’s no comparison. The first one we saw is bigger, quieter, and has much nicer furniture.’
better.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to a higher standard or quality
better.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
Your bike will run better if you oil it.
better.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: She knows this town better than you do.
I think I like the red one better.
Potter is better known for his TV work.
better.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to be higher in quality, amount etc than someone or something else
better.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: His total of five gold medals is unlikely to be bettered.
better.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: bettering the lot of the working classes
